body.p: Simal is a system to enable you to build your own catalogue for your own purposes. This document describes how to do this by following through a single example.

section.title: A Catalogue of Social Network Tools
section.p: We are going to build a catalogue that contains tools that are of interest to those working in the Social Networking domain.

section.title: Setup
section.p: Create a project folder mkdir catalogue
Seed the project folder cd catalogue simal seed-catalogue
Check everything is running OK - http://localhost:8888
At this point you have a very basic catalogue that contains a single project descriptor.

section.title: Add Projects
section.p: Now it is time to add your porojects to the catalogue. These are added by creating editing a locationmap file that describes the location of project descriptors. These descriptors can either be stored as a part of your local catalogue or they can be stored on some remotely accesible server.

section.title: Local project descriptors
section.p: by default your local descriptor files are located in src/documentation/content/rdf. To add a new project:
Add a DOAP file to this directory. For example sample.xml

Add an entry to the locationmap.xml so that Simal can find this DOAP file. For example:
<match pattern="project.descriptor.foo"> <location src="{properties:content}rdf/foo.xml"/> </match>
Restart Simal (only required if you have not turned off the locationmap cache)

section.title: Remote descriptor files
section.p: To add a project that maintains its own descriptor file:

Add an entry to the locationmap for the project in question. For example:
<match pattern="project.descriptor.simal"> <location src="http://simal.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/simal/src/documentation/content/rdf/simal.xml"/> </match>
Restart Simal (only required if you have not turned off the locationmap cache)
